keyword: calories in boneless skinless chicken thighs
title: Calories in Boneless Skinless Chicken Thighs
meta_description: Discover calories in boneless skinless chicken thighs per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, and nutrition breakdowns for easy meal planning.
h1: Calories in Boneless Skinless Chicken Thighs
assumptions: Cooked (grilled or baked), no added oil, salt, or seasonings; trimmed of visible fat.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cooking method, portion size, and sourcing; check labels or use a tracker for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked boneless skinless chicken thighs provides ~177 kcal and 24 g protein.

label_note: Values align with standard Nutrition Facts labels for comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil for cooking per 100 g
Marinated with 1 tbsp sauce per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g boneless skinless chicken thighs?
What's the protein content in boneless skinless chicken thighs?
faqs.a: About 24 g protein per 100 g cooked.

faqs.q: Do boneless skinless chicken thighs have carbs?
faqs.a: No carbs; they're nearly all protein and fat.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in chicken thighs?
faqs.a: Grilling or baking keeps calories lower than frying; raw is slightly less dense.

faqs.q: Are boneless skinless chicken thighs healthier than with skin?
faqs.a: Yes, skinless reduces fat and calories by about 50-100 kcal per 100 g.
